intro: Hippocrepis cornigera, commonly known as the Cornigera bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive blue to violet flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it typically grows in rocky or dry soils. It is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and slopes. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens, though it requires well-drained soil and full sun.
